benchmark_details.name: Assorted, Archetypal, and Annotated Two Million Extended (3A2M+) Cooking Recipe Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The 3A2M+ dataset contains two million culinary recipes labeled in respective categories with extended named entities extracted from recipe descriptions. It includes various features such as title, NER, directions, and extended NER, as well as nine different labels representing genres, providing a comprehensive solution for recipe classification, named entity recognition, and recipe generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large annotated dataset for automated recipe genre classification and related tasks.

data.source: The dataset is created from the 3A2M dataset with extended named entity extraction.
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts and automatic methods.

methodology.calculation: Standard evaluation metrics used to assess model performance.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates effective genre classification.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved accuracy of 98.6% with traditional machine learning and deep learning models.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through training, testing, and human-annotated data.
